identificationModule.briefTitle: Calcium Folinate Treatment of Spastic Paraplegia 56
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective Single Arm Clinical Trial of Calcium Folinate in the Treatment of Spastic Paraplegia 56

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Head of the Department of Neurology

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
SPG56 is one of the complicated and early-onset HSP subtypes caused by genetic mutations in CYP2U1. So far, there is no standardized and specific clinical therapy for SPG56. The goal of this clinical trial is to explore the efficacy and safety of calcium folinate in the treatment of SPG56 patients.

This study is prospective, open-label and single arm and this trial will last for 6 years. A total of 10 patients will participate and they will receive calcium folinate treatment and professional clinical evaluation regularly.

armGroups.label: calcium folinate treatment group
armGroups.description:
Drug: calcium folinate Phase I: calcium folinate infusion intravenously for 5 consecutive days at a dose of 1mg/kg/day in two divided doses per day. Then it was changed to oral administration at a dose of 2mg/kg/day during hospitalization.

Phase II: long-term oral medication at a dose of 2mg/ kg/day in two daily doses.

primaryOutcomes.description: The change in the Gross Motor Function Measure-88 (GMFM-88) score from baseline (range: 0-264, higher scores mean a better outcome).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the end of the 5-year follow-up period

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change in the Spastic Paraplegia Rating Scale (SPRS) score from baseline (range: 0-52, higher scores mean a worse outcome).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the end of the 5-year follow-up period

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change in the Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score from baseline (range: 0-30, higher scores mean a better outcome).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the end of the 5-year follow-up period

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change in the Laboratory indicators (blood biochemistry, lipid metabolism, folate, etc) and the number of participants with abnormal laboratory indicators.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the end of the 5-year follow-up period

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change in the cranial CT/MRI from baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the end of the 5-year follow-up period

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change in the gait examination from baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the end of the 5-year follow-up period

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change in the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) score from baseline (range: 0-30, higher scores mean a better outcome).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the end of the 5-year follow-up period

secondaryOutcomes.description: The change in the high density electroencephalogram from baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the end of the 5-year follow-up period
